args:
The party finds themselves relieved of their
sweets by fiends, and Althemia suggests
disguising themselves as those same fiends in
order to approach the culprits. The party goes
along with this suggestion and heads out to
gather materials for their costumes.
Yes. I'm glad the rest of you are, too.
It seems the fiends made off with them.
Um, actually, I've heard of this.
Apparently there are certain sweet-fanged\nfiends who attack villages and steal their\ntreats.
The fiends we just dealt with must be of\nthat particular variety.
And after all the trouble we went to!\nThere's no way we can complete our\ncandy-house centerpiece now.
If I may, everyone, we should cease\nmoping and continue work on the house.\nTime is growing ever nigh.
Hey, were you even listening?\nEverything got stolen by the fiends!
Not quite. It appears there are enough\ningredients left to form the basis of the\nSweet Retreat.
While it may be a bit more simplistic\nthan initially planned, we can at least\ncomplete the rough structure of the house.
Even though it may prove to be a meager\nsugary abode, we should push on and\nbuild it anyway.
A sweet crown jewel that each of us\nworked together on sounds more than\nsufficient for this party, does it not?
I'm with Edward. Let's use what we've got\nand build ourselves a house.
Using what materials remained, the group\nresumed construction on the Sweet Retreat.
This is bad! Or terrible! Or terribad!
*sigh* Does anyone else feel like there\nhave been a few too many fiend attacks\nof late?
It's been all day, every day. At this rate,\nwe won't have anything left.
And decorating for Halloween will come to\na complete standstill.
We've already run far over the alloted\nschedule as it is.
You're worried about the PARTY?\nWe should be worryin' about the fiends!
These jerks seem to know exactly where\nand how to strike us—and how to get\naway clean.
They always bolt before we can even try\nto mount a counterattack.
Perhaps it is time for us to turn the tables\nand launch an attack of our own?
Hmm... Well, I'm open to ideas if anyone\nhas them.
We can groan and moan all we like,\nbut it won't make a difference. Instead,\nwe must calmly assess the facts and—
WOULD YOU ALL SHUT UP AND LET ME\nTALK ALREADY?!
I'm TRYING to suggest a plan that the\nfiends won't be likely to suss out,\nbut you guys are all, ＂Yap, yap, yap!＂
Eeek! Umm, I really didn't... I'm sorry.\nI didn't mean to yell at everyone.
No, that's great! If you have a plan to get\nthe drop on those fiends, tell us!
You see, these fiends appear to be quite\nwary of any nearby humans.
So I thought that if we wore costumes,\nthey might...let down their guard a little?
I'm sorry, Althemia, but I don't see how\ncostumes will help us defeat them.
W-wait a minute! Let me finish!
What's important is that the fiends don't\ncatch on to the fact enemies are nearby.
So to avoid that, we'll make outfits using\nfiend-pelt cloth and the vegetation that\ngrows near their burrows.
These won't be just any costumes—they'll\nbe costumes that mimic the appearance\nof fiends!
Interesting. That would mean we would\nboth look AND smell like fiends.
Hmm, I see.\nThough I'm not sure how I feel about\ndressing up like a fiend...
Well, for what it's worth, I think this\nidea's aces!
Yeah, we don't get many opportunities to\nwear costumes. Let's make the most of it!
Right then. Let's do this while we still\nhave some candy left to save.
We'll gather up materials for the outfits\nbefore the fiends return.
What, NOW?! But it's night! ...Hey, wait!\nAre you listening?! I'm coming too!
